clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Fluid Challenge on Intracranial Pressure
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Intracranial Pressure Change by Measuring Optic Nerve Diameter During Fluid Challenge

brief_summary.textblock: Fluid challenge is frequently used in fluid management of critically ill patients. Assessing whether there is a preload reserve that can be used to increase the stroke volume by delivering a small amount of fluid in a short period of time. Optimization of fluid therapy is very important in intensive care patients. Inappropriate fluid therapy can cause significant morbidity and even mortality. Increased intracranial pressure is one of these important complications. In our study, we planned to examine intracranial pressure change with fluid challenge.

detailed_description.textblock: Hemodynamically unstable (hypotensive patients,mean arterial pressure below 65 mmHg) over 18 years of age with no known intracranial pathology were included in the study. Before and after Fluid Challenge, optic nerve sheath diameter was measured with the help of ultrasound and the effect of Fluid Challenge on intracranial pressure was investigated. 50 patients were included in the study as a result of literature review and power analysis (a minimum of 48 cases with 95% confidence , 80.3% test power.n the presence of hypotension, since preload and fluid responsiveness need to be evaluated, 500 ml of crystalloid (0.9% NaCl) (or 250 ml of colloid,Gelatin (Gelofucin) is administered intravenously in 10-15 minutes and the heart rate and the changes on the pressure were examined and the fluid needs were determined. efore and after Fluid Challenge, the optic nerve diameter was evaluated with a linear probe on the eye, taking the value at a distance of 3mm from the eyeball. In studies conducted, for adult patients, if the optic nerve sheath diameter is above 5 mm, the intracranial pressure value is considered to be above 20 cm water. Optic nerve sheath diameter values were taken before and after Fluid Challenge with the help of ultrasound, and it was investigated whether there was an increase in intracranial pressure in case of fluid loading.

primary_outcome.description: optic nerve diameter description > 5 mm or not
